page.title: 05TRANSPORT IN NORTH TYNEDALE
page.content: Since closure of the railway line,access is by the A68 to the east and B6320 the west of this block. The river North Tyne divides the area and is crossed to the North at Bellingham and south at Wark by bridges. Minor roads lead to farms and to dwellings and the only{public transport}is by the bus service linking Bellingham and Hexham with 7 return journeys daily except Sunday when there are 5. Buses and taxis carry{pupils to school}at Bellingham, Wark and Haydon Bridge and can be used by fare paying passengers as well.{Private transport}is essential here and consists of cars, landrovers, bicycles, motorcycles and tractors during winter snowstorms. {Movement of livestock}and farm produce is by trucks whilst tankers collect the milk direct from dairies.
